channel.title: PI Click Object Distance?
channel.description:
This isn't something I ever really needed to mess with, but now I actually found a reason.
My client has 525 (or something like that) maps I believe, which means it has the wilderness ditch.
Now, on the side from edgeville to enter the wilderness, when you click the ditch, the distance is only 1 square, which is perfect. But on the side from the wilderness to edgeville, it's like 3-5 i don't know exactly.
So jumping over the ditch won't work because it wants you to be 1 square away, meaning you're standing in front of it.
That would mean I need to change the distance the object needs me to be. I added this into ClickObject.java: [code] case 23271: c.objectDistance = 7; break; [/code] 23271 is the ID of all parts of the wildy ditch. 7 'should' make it so if I'm within 7 squares of the item, it will work. Well.. It doesn't.
I don't exactly know why, like I said I've never messed with this before. Also, others say this actually works. So I'm not understanding the issue.
Sorry for the bad wording/probably sounding like an idiot. I'm really tired but can't sleep.

item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

nathanz:

Did you ever figure this out? Having the same problem with a object lol

I stopped looking into it as I don’t use a client with that wildy ditch anymore. Also, notice this topic was from 2013… You should have just created a new topic if you are having an issue.

item.title: PI Click Object Distance?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:23, topic:524734”]do you not see the code? look what it is doing.

case 23271:
    c.objectDistance = (absX > 3520 ? 7 : 10); // you said 3-5 tiles so I assumed 10 would be fine
break;

if you’re 3 tiles away, change the distance to 10, but then it wouldn’t work the other way around, so you add the x factor[/quote]
Oh, I see the code.
I added it in to test.
I’ll give you 1 guess on what happened when I checked it out.

Give up?
Well not what you think
If I’m in the wildy, it moves me so I’m approx 2/3 tiles away.
But it still won’t actually move me to the other side.
And the server doesn’t pick up the object click ID until I’m 1 square away.

In the following picture, you will see 3 shapes.
A red circle, a red arrow, and a blue square.
Legend:
Red Circle - Where I clicked (it is the object)
Red Arrow - The direction I moved after clicking^
Blue Square - Where I need to be standing in order for me to be able to hop the ditch (for some reason, this is the entire issue, as you can’t stand there without ::noclip)

rGJ9oe2.png1046×340

Read full topic

item.title: PI Click Object Distance?
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

do you not see the code? look what it is doing.

case 23271:
    c.objectDistance = (absX > 3520 ? 7 : 10); // you said 3-5 tiles so I assumed 10 would be fine
break;

if you’re 3 tiles away, change the distance to 10, but then it wouldn’t work the other way around, so you add the x factor

Read full topic

item.title: PI Click Object Distance?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:21, topic:524734”][quote author=AtomicInt_ link=topic=643389.msg4330947#msg4330947 date=1373649124]
you’re all love nuts

the object id is the same, so do this:

case 23271: c.objectDistance = (absX > # ? 7 : 10); // you said 3-5 tiles so I assumed 10 would be fine break;
[/quote][/quote]
I had this in my ClickObject.java:

		case 23271:
			c.objectDistance = 7;
		break;

That is what all the other topics out there said worked.

Read full topic

item.title: PI Click Object Distance?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

For those wondering:

				if (c.absY > 3520) {
					c.getPA().ditchJump(c, 0, - 3);
				}
				if (c.absY <= 3518) {
					c.getPA().ditchJump(c, 0, 5);
				}
				if (c.absY == 3520) {
					c.getPA().ditchJump(c, 0, 3);
				}
				CycleEventHandler.getSingleton().addEvent(c, new CycleEvent() {
					@Override
					public void execute(CycleEventContainer container) {
						c.getPA().resetDitchJump(c);
						container.stop();
					}
					@Override
					public void stop() {

					}
				}, 4);

and this:

	public void ditchJump(final Client c, final int x, final int y) {
		c.getPA().walkTo(x ,y);
		c.isRunning2 = false;
		c.playerWalkIndex = 6132;
		c.getPA().requestUpdates();
	}
	public void resetDitchJump(final Client c) {
		c.isRunning2 = true;
		c.getPA().setConfig(173, 1);
		c.getCombat().getPlayerAnimIndex(c.getItems().getItemName(c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon]).toLowerCase());
		c.getPA().requestUpdates();
	}

This code works perfect.
The issue:
When I’m outside the wildy going in:
Spot-to-land|block|block|Wildy Ditch Object|Me
See how I’m only 1 spot away? Yeah, that allows it to work.
Now, here’s what it looks like when trying to exit:
Me|Block|Block|Wildy Ditch Object|Spot-To-Land
It won’t work. Why? Because there is 2 spots in front of me (maybe 3).
I need to change the distance it’s checking. and I’ve tried.

Read full topic

item.title: PI Click Object Distance?
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“Strucker, post:17, topic:524734”]How could that be possible? however why dont you just start making the jump anim from the longer side and then move your character’s pos to the other side?[/quote]so similar to agility? that could work

[code=java]/**
* when a player reaches he’s point the stopEmote() method gets called
* this method calculates when the player reached he’s point
*/

public void destinationReached(int x2, int y2, final int endingEmote) { 
    if (x2 >= 0 && y2 >= 0 && x2 != y2) { 
        Server.getTaskScheduler().schedule(new Task(x2+y2) { 
            @Override
            protected void execute() { 
                if (c.disconnected) { 
                    stop(); 
                    return; 
                } 
                if (moveHeight >= 0) { 
                    c.getPA().movePlayer(c.getX(), c.getY(), moveHeight); 
                    moveHeight = -1; 
                } 
                stopEmote(); 
                c.startAnimation(endingEmote); 
                this.stop(); 
            } 
        }); 
    } else if (x2 == y2) { 
        Server.getTaskScheduler().schedule(new Task(x2) { 
            @Override
            protected void execute() { 
                if (c.disconnected) { 
                    stop(); 
                    return; 
                } 
                if (moveHeight >= 0) { 
                    c.getPA().movePlayer(c.getX(), c.getY(), moveHeight); 
                    moveHeight = -1; 
                } 
                stopEmote(); 
                c.startAnimation(endingEmote); 
                this.stop(); 
            } 
        }); 
    } else if (x2 < 0) { 
        Server.getTaskScheduler().schedule(new Task(-(x2)+y2) { 
            @Override
            protected void execute() { 
                if (c.disconnected) { 
                    stop(); 
                    return; 
                } 
                if (moveHeight >= 0) { 
                    c.getPA().movePlayer(c.getX(), c.getY(), moveHeight); 
                    moveHeight = -1; 

                } 
                stopEmote(); 
                c.startAnimation(endingEmote); 
                this.stop(); 
            } 
        }); 
    } else if (y2 < 0) { 
        Server.getTaskScheduler().schedule(new Task(x2-(y2)) { 
            @Override
            protected void execute() { 
                if (c.disconnected) { 
                    stop(); 
                    return; 
                } 
                if (moveHeight >= 0) { 
                    c.getPA().movePlayer(c.getX(), c.getY(), moveHeight); 
                    moveHeight = -1; 

                } 
                stopEmote(); 
                c.startAnimation(endingEmote); 
                this.stop(); 
            } 
        }); 
    } [/code]

Read full topic

[quote=“Driman Rune, post:11, topic:524734”]case ditch:
if object x = here
client.getdialoguesSM(“You jump the ditch of “+SubCore.Name+”.”);
c.getobj().startjump();
}
else
if object x = here
c.getobj().reversejump();
client.getdialoguesSM(“you leavr the wilderness by jumping the ditch”);
}
break;

ripped it off mine. i think your handling is different[/quote]

That isn’t going to fix anything for me, because it is still checking if the object distance is 1.
